column1: Today is #SmallBusinessSaturday where we celebrate and support small businesses and all they do for their communities. This year they need our support more than ever as they navigate the effects of the coronavirus pandemic. If you plan to shop today #ShopLocal #ShopSmall https://t.co/jkvWxha6XA

Los Latinos han sido gravemente impactados por COVID-19. Es más importante que nunca tener seguro médico.  Hasta el 15 de Diciembre puede: ✅Actualizar su cobertura ✅Cambiar de proveedor médico ✅Renovar su plan  ¡Visite https://t.co/aXOUcp7C4J para ver sus opciones! https://t.co/QXDtHWhJoh

Join @MaderaDPH Officials Tues. Nov. 4th for a Facebook Live Event about COVID-19. Discussion centered on the latest information on and the opportunity for the public to ask questions.   Submit questions in advance by sending an email to: public.health@maderacounty.com. https://t.co/1pcsGWxfff

COVID-19 is spreading a rapid rate with positive cases rising throughout California and across the country. Help do your part to stop the spread and #WearAMask when you can't social distance. https://t.co/cvTL1GdBUr

The uptick in positive #COVID19 cases is alarming but we can get through this if we work together. Help slow the spread of this highly infectious disease: #WearAMask ! https://t.co/QcS9L8RyrX via @FacebookWatch

We have many challenges facing or country; COVID-19 the deep economic crisis and a lack of trust and civility in which Americans question whether their government can come together to find solutions to our problems.

Merced Co. residents concerned about COVID-19 and how to keep family and loved ones safe can join the Dept. of Public Health tomorrow Oct. 29th LIVE from 5:30p to 6:30p and get answers to their health questions.   Participate by using the link below: https://t.co/3mlZKwruew https://t.co/3Cl7NlJS3Y
As Halloween approaches it's important to take great care to prevent the spread of COVID-19. Follow these guidelines to keep yourself and others safe. #WearAMask https://t.co/obxvce7Mnl

Today we learned Madera County will stay in the 'Purple Tier' for the time being. If you have questions about that or anything else related to COVID-19 the Madera Co. Dept. of Public Health will hold a Facebook Live event to answer your questions. See below for more info: https://t.co/3ZmU4dc9fo

From now until 2:00 p.m. Madera County can get FREE COVID-19 tests at the La Esperanza Market. No appointment necessary.  If you're feeling symptoms of the coronavirus or have been or think you've been exposed please take advantage of this opportunity to get tested. https://t.co/FpUZNpCTQI

As we continue to grapple with the effects of COVID-19 the role of organizations like the UN are more important than ever.   On #UNDay let's reaffirm our commitment to continue working with our allies to make the world a safer and more prosperous place. https://t.co/4xHFIRVZd0

@MaderaDPH has been working hard to protect the community from #COVID19. The county now meets the metrics to move away from the Purple Tier but must meet same criteria for one more week to officially enter the Red Tier. https://t.co/9KBZBoSVDA

We passed the CARES Act to get much needed testing to our communities to help slow the spread of COVID-19. I'm proud to see these federal funds being used by @UCSFFresno to care for and keep people safe. Help do your part and #WearAMask when out in public. https://t.co/FhttmmXEMx

The #COVID19 pandemic is FUELING the housing crisis and millions of Americans are facing EVICTION.   #KnowYourRights. Find out if you qualify for protection from eviction.   Visit https://t.co/MYNZdbgNs3 for more information.

Last year I co-authored this op-ed with @RepMarciaFudge to address the problem with food insecurity in the U.S. and round the world - which this year has only been exacerbated this year by the COVID-19 pandemic. #WorldFoodDay #WorldFoodDay2020

My thoughts are with the President and First Lady at this difficult time and I wish them a speedy recovery. As Coronavirus reaches the highest levels of our government it's clear we need to act swiftly and decisively to bring relief to the American people. 1/2

@UCSFFresno's Mobile HeaL Unit has partnered with local community based organizations to provide increased access to free rapid COVID-19 testing and health screenings. Make your appointment today!  https://t.co/Qg2eSHPg0U

While the #TrumpAdmin has been downplaying the severity of this virus House Democrats have:  ✅ Passed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act ✅ Passed the #CARESAct ✅ Passed the #HeroesAct  We are fighting #ForThePeople https://t.co/WplNGausOo
Merced County residents: No cost COVID-19 testing will be available at the CVOC in Winton on September 24th. No insurance needed and walk-ins welcome! https://t.co/XtxvZ34IOq

Residentes de Madera: Pruebas gratis de COVID está sucediendo esta semana jueves el 17 de septiembre y viernes el 18 de septiembre.   Seguro de salud ni citas no son necesarios. Resultos estarán disponibles en tres a cinco días. #WearAMaskSaveALife https://t.co/Qvo2BwcFex

Madera Residents: Free COVID testing happening this week on Thursday 09/17 and Friday 09/18.  Insurance and appointments not needed. Results available in 3-5 days.  #WearAMaskSaveALife https://t.co/yrbq3MmWKM

Merced County Department of Public Health has expanded COVID-19 testing to mobile testing sites throughout the county.   There is no charge for the test and walk-ups are welcome.   GO here for more information: https://t.co/FaLo5HKPkl https://t.co/VnZiOmksCv

I had the opportunity to chat with Agri-Pulse today about the wildfires ravaging our state the possibility of another coronavirus relief package and the need for more relief for our farmers as we continue to fight our way through the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/vpyz2giZvz

Whether it's COVID-19 or hazardous air quality farm workers labor every day no matter the conditions to put healthy nutritious meals on our dinner tables every night. We must do all we can to protect them. #FarmworkersAreEssential https://t.co/bysTBeONjJ

Governor Newsom providing updates on the COVID-19 pandemic and the wildfires burning across the state - including the Creek Fire in Fresno and Madera Counties. Watch below LIVE: https://t.co/obCC0AfPnd

Holiday gatherings have lead to some of the highest spikes of COVID-19 in our communities - please reconsider celebrations with large group of people this weekend and help us slow the spread of this dreadful disease. https://t.co/dqpQF97ndb

New state legislation took effect 8/31 that protects many Californians who are unable to pay their rent or mortgage because of the COVID-19 pandemic.  See below for how you can possibly benefit: https://t.co/Od1GJUOHd4

This graph from Merced County shows how holiday weekends have lead to spikes of COVID-19 cases this summer - mainly due to large group gatherings as family and friends congregate to celebrate the holiday. https://t.co/blnU00MbPY

Residentes del Condado de Fresno que necesitan pruebas de COVID-19 tienen varias opciones. Citas tienen que ser hecho con anticipación y se requieren máscaras.   Para información sobre otras opciones para pruebas en el Condado sigue este enlace: https://t.co/mL2Qb4e0fr https://t.co/BKE0uuDTEH

The coronavirus crisis is hitting state & local government hard – forcing many to make devastating cuts to public education. #TheHeroesAct provides nearly $1 trillion in state & local relief to preserve funding for students and schools. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/Rx8LHsGdT9

Fresno County residents in need of COVID-19 testing have several options to choose from. Appointments must be made in advance and face masks are required.  For information on other testing options in the County follow this link: https://t.co/gkVeODMecW https://t.co/C4UaToQqbv

It's as simple as this: we must do more to stop the spread of COVID19:  Wash your hands. Don't congregate with groups outside your own household. Maintain a distance of 6 feet when around others. Stay home if you're sick.  And please always #WearAMask when out in public. https://t.co/W0IssoC8bH

You can’t fight #COVID19 without testing and contact tracing. Trump has refused to develop and implement a national strategy and this #FailuretoLead is costing lives. This is a national crisis that requires a national strategy. https://t.co/xabJA89WGc

The coronavirus knows no geographical social or economic boundaries. It does not discriminate. It’s our enemy and we are at war.  I penned this op-ed to stress the need for a national plan to fight this virus so we can get our country and our lives back on track! https://t.co/h2mNJX0YfN
The Central California Blood Center needs your help! If you've recently recovered from COVID-19 your donated plasma can help save lives.  Fill out a Donor Request Form below: https://t.co/3OfbMdv25P

I have the hardest working staff in Congress.  Not only do these men and women work to tirelessly everyday to improve the lives of constituents in my district they work hard fighting COVID-19 by wearing a mask wherever they go.  We’re all in this together. #WearAMaskSaveALife https://t.co/zC5JRNP6Gu

COVID19 has shown how important access to quality high speed internet is for Americans. Especially impacted are rural areas that still lag more populated communities in their ability to virtually connect with teachers doctors and other essential services. #RuralBroadbandDay https://t.co/CC0ttvey0p
Con casos positivos aumentando en nuestro valle a una velocidad alarmante es importante que trabajamos juntos para protegernos de COVID-19. #WearAMaskSaveALife  https://t.co/fTUpnw0q8s

To win the battle over COVID-19 it will take all of us working together.  Wash your hands. Maintain a distance of 6 feet. Don't congregate with groups outside of those you live with. #WearAMask. And if you're sick stay home.  https://t.co/MyPPnIZAEp
When done properly wearing a mask is one of the most effect thing you can do to help stop the spread of COVID-19. #WearAMaskSaveALife https://t.co/Ww9qn0x3Wi

The COVID 19 pandemic has disproportionately affected the laborers in our farming communities and I’m pleased to see Governor Newsom expand protections for these men and women at a time when they are needed most to help feed American families. 2/2

Since the beginning of the COVID-19 crisis the U.S. has faced shortages of medical supplies like masks and diagnostic tests  that are critical to saving lives and slowing the spread of the virus. The Admin must fully employ the Defense Production Act! #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/gtzZoPGJLM

50000 Americans have lost their lives to COVID-19 in the nine weeks since @HouseDemocrats passed the #HeroesAct. Why is the Senate dragging its feet on this must-pass legislation that gives American communities the tools to fight this crisis? https://t.co/DYtEfcRpqd

One of my top priorities is to see our taxpayer dollars return to the district. I'm pleased to report that Castle Family Health Centers Inc. in Atwater has received critical funding to expand their #Covid19 testing efforts. https://t.co/axGrsyjWyn
The @CityofFresno and United Health Centers will host NO COST drive-up COVID19 testing on Friday July 17th. Registration is required in advance: https://t.co/PmAVzXNQtK

Effective today - more closures for businesses across the state as COVID19 continues to spread. These new measures are in effect for Fresno Madera and Merced Counties.  #WearAMaskSaveLives https://t.co/e3wzlaPQb9
Protect yourself and loves ones from Covid19.  Thov siv lub npog qhov ncauj qhov ntswg ntaub los npog ntsej muag. #WearAMaskSaveLives https://t.co/Du2hOcwJ3s
Contact tracing is an important step in slowing the spread of COVID-19. All you have to do is answer the phone. https://t.co/QyaAzKQV5M

Free or no-cost COVID19 testing is available to Madera County residents now. Appointments must be made in advance.  Go here for more info: https://t.co/oP8zg9XIko…/publ…/covid-19/covid19testing https://t.co/5lcbSFOnh8

The @CityofFresno has teamed up with United Health Centers of the San Joaquin Valley for no-cost COVID-19 testing.  The next event takes place from 8:30am - 2:30pm this weekend July 10th & 11th. For more info and details on how to register see below:  https://t.co/Fz9fWfL00c

Help slow the spread!  One of the ways you can protect yourself from coronavirus is by washing your hands thoroughly for 20 seconds.  For more tips go here: https://t.co/S7IZWE54Nx…/…/Pages/Immunization/ncov2019.aspx https://t.co/dit7TRXkw2
The LAST thing we need right now is a testing slowdown. The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct to ensure coronavirus testing is available nationwide! https://t.co/sGxrgM5pqB

As America confronts the coronavirus pandemic it has never been more important for our community to have access to #LowerCostsForCare. Proud to join other House Democrats last week in taking action #ForThePeople! https://t.co/Au1w0j1mzY

Testing saves lives. It's that simple.    The LAST thing we need right now is a testing slowdown. The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct to ensure coronavirus testing is available nationwide! https://t.co/ujqkk6TJIM
Madera County residents: this week the Department of Public Health is offering free drive-through mobile COVID-19 testing. No appointment needed: https://t.co/eP6TqMx452

Next week I will join other state Representatives for a special COVID-19 Town Hall airing on @KSEE24 on May 27th.  I want to hear from you! If you have a question you'd like to ask follow the link below to submit a question. https://t.co/m9P01rmmv6

Free online courses available for essential workers!  In response to the COVID-19 outbreak @Fresno_State is offering free online courses to our amazing essential workers in the community!  See below for more details: https://t.co/hT5dHN7QKU

This is a huge win for our Valley and its residents. We simply do not have enough doctors to care for our growing population a problem only exacerbated in the coronavirus health crisis.   https://t.co/rb3uKd0Iid

Volunteer at a food bank donate blood or simply check in with a neighbor. There’s so much you can do to help your community through COVID-19. We're all in this together and together is how we'll overcome this crisis. https://t.co/vDQZpBMqrs via @YouTube

The #COVID crisis has reinforced the importance of ensuring we have adequate healthcare in all our communities. I have been working to close those gaps and have redoubled my efforts to push for more funding to train and deploy doctors in our most under-served communities.

On this #WorldHealthDay join me in showing gratitude to the brave frontline health professionals across the globe who are working tirelessly to respond to the #COVID19 crisis.  Today and every day their selfless work keeps us healthy and safe.

Recent studies suggest that many people with COVID-19 don't show symptoms but can still transmit the virus. The CDC now recommends using face masks in public settings to further limit the spread of the virus. Find out how to make your own:  https://t.co/9GOqNL5exX

Hemos concentrada toda la información sobre COVID-19 que necesita en un lugar conveniente. Happy Birthday #ACA! 10 years later the #AffordableCareAct is protecting 130 million Americans with pre-existing conditions to ensure they access to the health care they need as we fight COVID-19. #ProtectOurCare https://t.co/4Gh6ucgUT0

Small business owners in CA are eligible to apply for a low-interest loan due to COVID-19.  The SBA will work directly to provide targeted low-interest loans to small businesses and non-profits that have been severely impacted by this health crisis.  https://t.co/oC7YxcGLso

California has a new one stop resource for COVID-19 information.  The site highlights critical steps people can take to stay healthy and resources available to Californians impacted by the outbreak including paid sick leave and unemployment assistance.   https://t.co/V7vo5jHazP

These are trying times for our nation and we must do what we can to ensure the health and safety of our loved ones and families. Effective immediately my staff will telework to minimize exposure to COVID-19. https://t.co/4dFmqxXXHv

The health and safety of all Americans is my top priority as we cope with this health crisis. Today we saw the impact the coronavirus pandemic is having on our communities the economy and the world. https://t.co/JCSaOZHtnF

There is currently no vaccine to prevent COVID-19. The best way to prevent illness is to avoid exposure to the virus. However the CDC recommends everyday preventive strategies to help prevent its spread: https://t.co/zxw8RzQL6C https://t.co/cyAibtMtxN

If you or someone you know has or believes to have coronavirus my office can help! We can provide you with resources or connect you with healthcare officials.  Contact one of our district offices:  Fresno District Office 559-495-1620  Merced District Office 209-384-1620
HAPPENING NOW: I’m holding a round table with valley health officials to discuss coordinated efforts to prevent the spread of Coronavirus. https://t.co/uaJyusb19y
